content:
vkv supports all of Vaults environment variables. In order to authenticate you will have to set at least VAULT_ADDR and VAULT_TOKEN.
⚠️ Your token policy requires read and list capabilities on every path of the specified secret engine, otherwise vkv errors with 403. This behaviour is likely to change in future releases.
title: Authentication

content:
Clone this repository and run:
make bootstrap in order to have all used build dependencies
You can spin up a development vault for local testing by running:
make vault The following environment variables are required:
export VAULT_ADDR=&#34;http://127.0.0.1:8200&#34; export VAULT_TOKEN=&#34;root&#34; export VKV_PATH=&#34;secret&#34; If everything worked fine, you should be able to run:
go run main.go secret/ ├── demo │ └── foo=*** ├── sub │ └── sub=******** ├── sub/ │ └── demo │ ├── demo=*********** │ ├── password=****** │ └── user=***** └── sub/ └── sub2/ └── demo ├── password=******* ├── user=******** └── value=*********
